author: John Hutchinson for MailOnline
title: Drunk couple stole plane's €50 emergency exit key in 'a prank' that could have cost the airline €30k
text:
View
comments
A drunk couple who were visiting Ireland for a wedding stole the key to the emergency exit of a plane as 'a prank'.
Larysa Markuslevska, 41, and Anatolie Ilvitki, 29, had flown to the country from Moldova, on Air Moldova, when they decided to take the key with them as they disembarked.
The item was only recovered after security officials were forced to search the pair.
The couple had flown into Dublin Airport with Air Moldova to attend a wedding in Ireland
At a hearing at Dublin District Court they admitted theft and were instructed to make a €500 (£370) charity donation. They escaped a criminal conviction.
The court heard that had the key not been found, the plane would not have been able to take-off for the next flight and the airline would be facing costs of €30,000 (£22,000).

Share this article Share Ilvitki, who had exited the aircraft with the key in his bag, had been drinking 'quite an amount on the plane over,' his solicitor Brian Doherty told the court, as reported in the Belfast Telegraph .
Doherty added that it had been done as 'a prank,' and that the defendant doesn't fully remember why he did it.
If the key had not been recovered the airline would have been facing costs of €30,000, a Dublin judge said
His partner Markuslevska had also been drinking, and told the court that she couldn't even remember the incident taking place.
'Chaos would have ensued,' had the key not been found, said judge Grainne O'Neill.
'It would have been a very serious matter but I accept what you are saying about the condition they may have been in.'
The pair were ordered to pay €250 (£185) each to a Motor Neurone Disease charity.
MailOnline Travel has contacted Air Moldova for comment and is awaiting a response.
